summary: A character reference letter written to Judge Alison J. Nathan in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's bail request, dated November 23, 2020. The author, a close confidant, attests to Maxwell's honesty, organization, and philanthropic character, and offers to co-sign a $3.5 million bond secured by family properties.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The letter is addressed to her as the presiding judge over Ghislaine Maxwell's case, requesting consideration for bail.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the bail request and character reference. The author defends her character, honesty, and states she has remained in the US to face allegations.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'the late Jeffrey Epstein' in relation to charges against him that also involve Maxwell.

connections.description: The author states they are one of Maxwell's closest confidants and advisors, communicate weekly, and have a long-standing personal and family friendship.
Implied by the reference to 'new charges against the late Jeffrey Epstein' in a context that also involves Maxwell.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020.

events.title: Bail Request Submission
events.description: This character reference letter is submitted in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's request for bail.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A close confidant of Ghislaine Maxwell wrote a character reference to Judge Alison Nathan supporting Maxwell's bail request.
The author states Maxwell remained in the United States to be available to deal with civil or criminal allegations related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The author confirms Maxwell provided evidence under oath in a deposition in civil litigation.
The author offers to co-sign a $3.5 million bond, secured by family properties, to support Maxwell's bail.
The author asserts Maxwell has never been involved in any prior allegation of breaking the law and describes her as organized, clear, and honest.
